analytic.title: Die Vorlage der syrischen Sirachübersetzung und die gereimte hebräische Paraphrase zu Ben Sira aus der Ben-Ezra-Geniza

monogr.title: Texts and Contexts of the Book of Sirach / Texte und Kontexte des Sirachbuches

biblStruct.note: The vorlage of the Syriac translation of Ben Sira was an extended and reedited Hebrew recension of the book of Ben Sira. It included a concept on the topic "book of live" in chapter 1, 43 and 50 and some other passages in the Hebrew book. In 2015 new fragments of a rhymed Hebrew paraphrase on the hebrew Ben Sira could be identified using the Friedberg Genizah Project Portal. The 26 pages belong to a tractate from the 13th century with elements of Piyyut and are based on a medieval hebrew version of Ben Sira with texts of the chapters Sir 22-23, 34-45, 48 and 50-51 some of which are not known from other hebrew Ben Sira manuscripts. Ezra Fleischer had published half of this paraphrase in his work on Said Ben Babshad but had not been used widely in Ben Sira research. The thesis of Moshe Segal of a third Hebrew version of Ben Sira underlaying the Syriac version is discussed with these new facts.
